ygData.subject: Re: FLOWING BLACK SILK SASH TEST
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Another note on the sash, while the test posted showed it with a L27 bard, you can forget getting one until you can take a tough group of L45+ players into
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, Sep 27/99, Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...> wrote:
> From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>
> At 06:23 AM 9/27/99 -0700, you wrote:
>
> >>From these results it is easy to see that the Flowing Black Silk Sash and
> >Anthem de Arms do indeed Stack thier Speed increases. In Fact, when
> >Comined
> >together their enhancements are far Better than the sum of thier parts. In
> >some way when comBined they totally rule. Using Both the Sash and Singing
> >Anthem De Arms I took a 21/7 weapon down to a 14/7 one, and a 24/8 down to
> >15/8. These are phenomenal stats. Get a Sash when you can. They are
> >great
> >stuff.
>
> >From EQ Lizer:
> "This is one of the most sought after items in the game for melee classes.
> It is worn in your belt slot. It increases your attack speed by roughly 25%
> and can be found in Lower Guk."

Another note on the sash, while the test posted showed it with a L27
bard, you can forget getting one until you can take a tough group of
L45+ players into lower guk, unless your guild is very pro-twinking.
